snippet: Dr. Margaret Hamburg, who led the Food and Drug Administration for nearly six years, was praised and criticized for speeding the approval of medicines.
abstract: Food and Drug Administration Commissioner Dr Margaret Hamburg will step down following six-year tenure leading agency through some significant and challenging issues in public health; Hamburg grappled with painkiller abuse, obesity and the rise of electronic cigarettes, and received both praise and criticism for speeding up the approval of medicines.
lead_paragraph: Dr. Margaret Hamburg, who led the Food and Drug Administration for nearly six years, was praised and criticized for speeding the approval of medicines.

headline.main: F.D.A. Commissioner Leaving After Six Years of Breakneck Changes
headline.print_headline: F.D.A. Commissioner Leaving After Six Years of Breakneck Changes
